item.title: Two forms of state to props
item.description: Recently I was reviewing the code of an application written in React and redux. One particularly "simplified" form of implementation of mapStateToProps caught my attention. At first it looked clever, but then it made question the consequences of such approach. When working with class components in React, one's way to map values from the redux state to properties in the component, is through the function mapStateToProps in combination with redux' connect.
